comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: This appears likely to have been taken during the visit of three ships from the German fleet to the USA in early June, 1912. It has plate number 2729-5. Lieutenant Work appears in a photograph associated with that visit which has plate number 2729 - 12 here: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3512136817/ and here is a New York Times article (thanks to Pixel Wrangler ) about the visit although Prince Christian is not mentioned : query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9C05E...

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: good detective "Work", that sure looks like Lt. Work.

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: No mention of "Lieutenant Work" either ;-) The sailor-prince is likely (German) Lieutenant Commander Christian Prinz von Hessen-Philippsthal-Barchfeld [sic Hesse-Philippstadt-Barchfeld] [sic von Hessen-Phillips-thai-Barchfeld] (1887-1971). He visited Washington and New York aboard the Stettin, with the German Cruiser Squadron in June, 1912. –Compiled [1] [2] [3] [4]
